intro: Galium elongatum var. saturejifolium, commonly known as the purplestem gallium, is a herbaceous perennial native to North America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, ascending stems that often become woody with age. The plant features opposite, ovate to elliptic leaves that are usually hairy and have a bluish-green hue. Its small, white to pale pink flowers are clustered in umbels and bloom in early summer. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodlands and along stream banks.
